alert.note: Alert for Essex; Lancaster; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 12:52PM EDT until July 16 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Essex County in east central Virginia... Southeastern Richmond County in east central Virginia... Southeastern Westmoreland County in east central Virginia... Northwestern Lancaster County in eastern Virginia... Northwestern Northumberland County in eastern Virginia... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 1252 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 3 to 5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tappahannock, Warsaw, Callao, Robley, Farnham, Haynesville, Kinsale, Sharps, Morattico, Heathsville, Lewisetta, Dunnsville, Westmoreland, Village, Gibeon, Mulch, Emmerton, Downing, Oldhams and Moon Corner. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...3-5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
